I came to Tosca with a friend while we were on vacation in Barcelona in September.  It is a small and lively place with a great ambience in the Gothic Quarter.  We really liked the quaint setup/decor of the restaurant, and the music in the background was a nice touch.We started off with a pitcher of red sangria.  Though the sangria was not as fruity and flavorful as I generally prefer, it was strong enough to feel good after a half pitcher (split with my friend) and fairly cheap.  For tapas, we ordered the baby squid, the chorizo, the rustic pizza, and the empanadas.  Though the baby squid was fried perfectly, it was a little bland.  The chorizo was also lacking a bit in spice, though it was hearty.  The rustic pizza (containing sweet potatoes, chorizo, feta) was delicious- though a seemingly random grouping, the combination of flavors was amazing, and all the ingredients managed to stand out.  My favorite, however, was the empanada dish (caramelized onion, goat cheese, mozzarella, walnuts).  Caramelized onion and goat cheese are a naturally great, rich pairing; combined with the crunch of the walnuts, the empanadas were heavenly.I would definitely come back here if I come back to Barcelona; it is a great tapas bar.
